title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Large study of scientists who move their labs reveals how location drives productivity
items.description: Concentrating funding at high-powered universities can maximize output, paper argues, but may sacrifice broader benefits

items.title: Molecular fossils offer first glimpse of how life survived Snowball Earth
items.description: Overlooked rock samples from 640 million years ago record microbes hanging on beneath frozen oceans

items.title: Paleontologist to lead U.S. national academy
items.description: The prestigious organization faces funding challenges and political controversies

items.title: Majority of fruit fly immunity studies can be replicated, huge analysis finds
items.description: Verification of 50 years of data bolsters immunology research, but identifies “suspicious” papers that don’t hold up

items.title: Ancient human ancestor emerges from sunken Southeast Asian landmass
items.description: Submerged fossils are revealing long-held secrets from a region known as Sundaland

items.title: ‘Something remarkable has happened’: Cancer treatments bolster evidence of a natural HIV cure
items.description: In exclusive chat with <cite>Science</cite>, Loreen Willenberg describes remaining HIV-free even after immune-suppressing therapies for brain and lung tumors

items.title: Congressional spending panels continue to push back against proposed Trump research cuts
items.description: House committees give a real boost to DOE science and shrink size of cuts to NSF and NASA science

items.title: Analysis: Will the government hike indirect cost payments in return for greater accountability?
items.description: Under new plan, universities would detail the full cost of research

items.title: New study blames diet, not physical inactivity, for obesity crisis
items.description: But some scientists warn the research, which compared energy burned across populations, can’t reveal the epidemic’s causes

items.title: Countries to budget more for HIV/AIDS measures as U.S. withdraws aid
items.description: South Africa plans modest spending increase, but shortfalls will limit prevention and treatment
